SEARCH
Package io.avery.conveyor

Interface Belt.StepSink<In>

Type Parameters:
In - the input element type
All Superinterfaces:
Belt.Sink<In>, Belt.Stage
Enclosing class:
Belt
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public static interface Belt.StepSink<In> extends Belt.Sink<In>
A Sink that can accept input elements one at a time.

This is a functional interface whose functional method is push(Object).

  • Method Details

    • push

      boolean push(In input) throws Exception
      Pushes the input element to this sink for processing. Returns false if this sink cancelled during or prior to this call, in which case the element may not have been fully processed.
      Parameters:
      input - the input element
      Returns:
      false if this sink cancelled, else true
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if input is null
      Exception - if unable to push
      Implementation Requirements
      Once this method returns false, subsequent calls should also discard the input element and return false, to indicate the sink is permanently cancelled and no longer accepting elements. This method should not permit null inputs.

    • drainFromSource

      default boolean drainFromSource(Belt.StepSource<? extends In> source) throws Exception
      Pulls as many elements as possible from the source to this sink. This proceeds until either an exception is thrown, this sink cancels, or this sink is unable to accept more elements from the source (which does not necessarily mean the source drained). Returns true if the source definitely drained, meaning a call to pull returned null; else returns false.
      Specified by:
      drainFromSource in interface Belt.Sink<In>
      Parameters:
      source - the source to drain from
      Returns:
      true if the source drained
      Throws:
      Exception - if unable to drain
      Implementation Requirements
      The implementation loops, pulling from the source and pushing to this sink, until either the source drains or this sink cancels. This is equivalent to the implementation of StepSource.drainToSink(StepSink).

    • compose

      default Belt.Station compose(Belt.Source<? extends In> upstream)
      Connects the upstream source before this sink. Returns a new station that, when run, will drain from the upstream source to this sink.
      Parameters:
      upstream - the upstream source
      Returns:
      a new station that will drain from the source to this sink
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if upstream is null

    • compose

      default <T> Belt.Sink<T> compose(Belt.Segue<? super T,? extends In> upstream)
      Connects the upstream segue before this sink. Returns a new sink that behaves like the segue's sink, except that running it will also run the station formed by connecting the segue's source before this sink.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the upstream sink element type
      Parameters:
      upstream - the upstream segue
      Returns:
      a new sink that also runs a downstream station
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if upstream is null
